title_full:
Emahoy Tsege Mariam Gebru

              —
              Souvenirs
            
              (Mississippi Records)
label: Mississippi Records
description:
Real heart-stopping, life-affirming, almost indescribably beautiful posthumous album featuring (for the first time) vocal works by beloved, dearly departed, Ethiopian nun and now-legendary pianist/composer Emahoy Tsege Mariam Gebru, room recorded straight to tape between 1977-1985, sounds of life just about audible in the background. Almost had an out of body experience listening to it the other night - just a perfect, 10/10 album.

’Souvenirs’ is an intimate self-portrait written, recorded and compiled by the late Emahoy Tsege... more

release: Antología 1: Obras para la Orquesta Experimental de Instrumentos Nativos
title_full:
Cergio Prudencio

              —
              Antología 1: Obras para la Orquesta Experimental de Instrumentos Nativos
            
              (Buh Records)
label: Buh Records
description:
Just the most incredible archival record we’ve heard this year - 90 minutes of completely elevated works, 1985-2015, from Bolivia’s Cergio Prudencio and his compositions for traditional instruments from the Andean highlands, like some lost Mica Levi-arranged suite of orchestrations, all bent flutes x quiet-loud dynamics...

What might an orchestra sound like if it were made up of completely different instruments, like the siku, a traditional Andean two-row panpipe, the tarka, a wooden Andean blockflute, the mohoceño, a duct flute, the pinkillo, a... more

title_full:
Broadcast

              —
              Spell Blanket - Collected Demos 2006 - 2009
            
              (Warp Records)
label: Warp Records
description: A 36-track anthology of 4-track and minidisc recordings from Trish Keenan's archive, 'Spell Blanket' is as close as we're gonna get to Broadcast's mythical fifth album, and it's a labyrinthine heart-melter. Not just a selection of demos like 'Distant Call', this one's a fuzzy image of what the finished album might have been, with psychedelic synth experiments, organ jams, hymnals and tape-mangled poems interrupting Keenan and James Cargill's unmistakable reverb-drenched arrangements. We can hardly believe it's finally been... more

title_full:
CHBB

              —
              CHBB
            
              (Soulsheriff Records)
label: Soulsheriff Records
description:
Yeah, you’re not seeing things. Electronic body musick’s near-mythical ground zero is finally issued in its entirety, expanding the 9 known cuts of 1981 with no fewer than 11 never-before-heard jams from the same sessions. Take a second to drink that in, then pounce if you know what’s good! E-S-S-E-N-T-I-A-L RIYL Liaisons Dangereuses, Einstürzende Neubauten, DAF, Chris Carter…!!!!!!!

As legend has it, Düsseldorf’s Chrislo Haas & Beate Bartel laid the blueprint for EBM with their fateful studio sessions as CHBB... more

release: Further Selections from The Electric Harpsichord
title_full:
CATHERINE CHRISTER HENNIX

              —
              Further Selections from The Electric Harpsichord
            
              (Blank Forms Editions)
label: Blank Forms Editions
description:
NYC’s Blank Forms set fire to mind with an astonishing - arguably definitive - recording of the landmark work that first introduced CC Hennix’s secretive oeuvre to the world at large. Life-affirming, concentrated, hallucinogenic minimalism tuned to just intonation - RIYL Pandit Pran Nath, La Monte Young, Julius Eastman, Connor Camburn

In 2010, Die Schachtel’s CD issue of ‘The Electric Harpsichord’ introduced the entrancing music of (the now) late, great composer and polymath Catherine Christer Hennix [1948-2023] to a cohort of keen... more

title_full:
TERRE THAEMLITZ

              —
              Tranquilizer (30th Anniversary Restored & Expanded Edition 1994-2024)
            
              (Comatonse Recordings)
label: 30th Anniversary Restored & Expanded Edition 1994-2024
description:
Among our most loved ‘90s ambient house records, Terre Thaemlitz’s debut album is mercifully - finally - expanded and reissued for its 30th anniversary, including an incredible prototype for ambient Memphis rap instrumentals and some would even say dubstep - now expanded to well over two hours long, with a delectable bonus disc full of deep cuts.

One that puts a lump in our throat from the opening strokes, ‘Tranquillizer’ marks a key point of departure for Thaemlitz from the deep house they DJ’d at NYC clubs from the late ‘80s to... more

title_full:
Alex Zhang Hungtai

              —
              Young Gods Run Free
            
              (Modern Love)
label: Modern Love
description: Modern Love grip the inimitable genius of Alex Zhang Hungtai  - a saxophonist-composer and actor renowned for his work as Dirty Beaches and Love Theme, appearing in David Lynch’s ‘Twin Peaks: The Return’, and more recently scoring the award-winning ‘Godland’ - for a maiden vinyl edition of his ravishingly cacophonous and noirish 2020 free jazz salvo. Spliced together from five years of grotty phone memo recordings into a miasmic reverie of echoing percussion and gusty, serpentine sax, it’s a real time-dilating wonder that sits... more

release: Playing It Cool & Playing It Right
title_full:
Keith Hudson

              —
              Playing It Cool & Playing It Right
            
              (Basic Replay / Week-End Records)
label: Basic Replay / Week-End Records
description:
One of the most distinctive and legendary vocal/dub albums of all time, recorded in 1981 by the “dub dentist” Keith Hudson, ‘Playing It Cool & Playing It Right’ is now back in circulation for the first time in over 20 years, when it was first given overdue flowers via Basic Channel And Honest Jon’s ‘Basic Replay’ programme. It still burns with a rare energy, making it an untouchable, foundational text for the ages.

Keith Hudson (1946-1984) was one of dub reggae’s most distinctive innovators, renowned for a run of classic solo albums... more

title_full:
Cukor Bila Smert'

              —
              Recordings 1990-1993
            
              (Shukai)
label: Shukai
description:
The wide-eyed, theatric art-pop and psych-folk wonders of Svitlana Nianio’s early band, Cukor Bila Smert’, come to light via Ukrainian reissue specialists Shukai on this mindboggling 31-track, 90 minute anthology of studio recordings made between 1990-1993, contorting gothic folk around brittle, calypso-inspired drum loops and oddball new wave bullets, a sort of missing link on the spectrum between Broadcast, Stroom, Lubos Fiser and Les Disques Du Crépescule.

Cukor Bila Smert’ (trans: Sugar — White Death) was a band formed by... more

title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              funk.BR - São Paulo (NTS)
            
              (NTS)
label: NTS
description:
Major! NTS deploys a sprawling, heads-fwd selection of São Paulo's maddest contemporary funk machinations: hybridided dancefloor eccentricity that splices squirmy Afro-Portuguese bumps and MC yawps with snatches of drill, hard techno, electro-house, trance and blown-out 8-bit chirps. Educate yrself - this is some of the most dizzying, dynamic club music we've heard in ages.

São Paulo is a churning, cultural cement mixer of a city, bursting with diverse influences that spring from its patchwork of ethnic groups. While there are millions of... more

release: Lost Paradise: Blissed Out  Breakbeat Hardcore 1991-94
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Lost Paradise: Blissed Out  Breakbeat Hardcore 1991-94
            
              (BLANK MIND)
label: BLANK MIND
description:
Blank Mind herald the dark/light, ruff/sweet dualities of early UK breakbeat hardcore and techno with a killer haul of tunes from Skanna, Escape, Sleepwalker, The Invisible Man, DJ Mayhem and more

After previously hinting at their fascination in this arena with a 2022 reissue of Earth Leakage Trip’s ‘Psychotronic’  - the first Moving Shadow 12”, issued in 1991 - Sam Purcell’s label go all-in with eight properly licensed cuts of prime rave gear characterised by rushy fluxes of euphoria and melancholia, velocity and weightlessness, all from... more

title_full:
R.N.A. Organism

              —
              R.N.A.O Meets P.O.P.O
            
              (Mesh-Key Records)
label: Mesh-Key Records
description:
Japan, 1980, drum machine dub? Originally issued by Vanity Records (home of those mind-bogglingly fwd Tolerance albums), R.N.A. Organism's only full-length is an eccentric collage of metallic beatbox loops, robotic voices and glockenspiel vamps - like chopped 'n screwed no wave/industrial/mutant dub gear with a prophetic Japanese twist. Compulsory set, obviously; RIYL Throbbing Gristle, Bruce Gilbert, Suicide.

Lovingly remastered by Stephan Mathieu from the original reel-to-reel tapes, 'R.N.A.O Meets P.O.P.O' is an... more

title_full:
BARK PSYCHOSIS

              —
              Hex
            
              (Fire Records)
label: Fire Records
description:
Quite literally the definitive and arguably one of the most influential post-rock albums ever made, newly remastered and reissued 30 years since it came out back in 1994. If you’re into Talk Talk’s Laughing Stock / Spirit of Eden, Chicago’s nebulous guitar/jazz movements, or the interconnected wave of loosely likeminded bands (Hood, Pan American etc)  - welcome to your new obsession.

Back in 1994, Hex sounded like a new kind of music - one built on foundations laid by Talk Talk (whose drummer Lee David Harris has a credit on ‘Hex’ and... more

title_full:
James Tenney

              —
              Postal Pieces
            
              (Blume)
label: Blume
description: James Tenney was a student of composition under John Cage, Harry Partch and Edgard Varèse, among others, and ‘Postal Pieces’ (1965 - 1971) is arguably his most well known and influential project, driven by a lifelong interest in incorporating observations of everyday life into his work. To that end, he summoned his friends - including Pauline Oliveros, La Monte Young, Harold Budd, Philip Corner, Max Neuhaus and others - to compose new music based off obscure instructions he sent them by postcard (replicas of which are included as... more

title_full:
G.F.X.

              —
              Eternal
            
              (Magic Ritmo)
label: Magic Ritmo
description:
Whew!!! A cult ambient-electro/acid-house torpedo, 1990 - loaded with the 100BPM bomb ‘Eternal’ and new beat-y thrust of ‘The Chill’ - finally sees light of day, making countless veteran ravers and younger connoisseurs wet their gruds - massive RIYL Vladimir Ivkovic, Fergus Clark’s 12th Isle, Dr. Stevie the Ambient Guru, LFO, AFX, H.I.A.

Ladies and radge packets, the eagle has landed: Whitley Bay’s Geoff Waterson, aka G.F.X., gives his blessing for a remastered and fully licensed pressing of his sole, debut 12” holy grail; produced... more

release: Music for Shape​-​Shifters: Field Recordings from the Amazonian Lowlands, 1981​-​1985
title_full:
Wakuénai (Curripaco)

              —
              Music for Shape​-​Shifters: Field Recordings from the Amazonian Lowlands, 1981​-​1985
            
              (Sublime Frequencies)
label: Sublime Frequencies
description:
Sublime Frequencies are on their A* game with these mesmerising tape recordings made by Wakuénai villagers upriver in early ‘80s Venezuela, documenting all night ceremonial sessions, anthropomorphic flute calls, and voyages on the Upper Río Negro ... 

‘Music for Shape - Shifters 1981 - 1985’ firmly marks Sublime Frequencies' return to their core interests in field recording and ethnomusicology after excursions into modernity via Egyptian band The Handover earlier in ’24. A seven-part suite spanning guttural wind expressions to... more

title_full:
Cocteau Twins And Harold Budd

              —
              The Moon And The Melodies (2024 Remaster)
            
              (4AD)
label: 2024 Remaster
description:
Remastered from the original tapes by Robin Guthrie and reissued on vinyl for the first time, 'The Moon and the Melodies' is one of the Cocteau Twins' most sublime sets, a blissful marriage of horizontal piano-laced ambience and glistening dream pop.

"It's not Cocteau Twins, and it's not me," Budd said in a 1986 interview, "it's an odd combination peculiar to the mixture." He'd never heard the band until bassist Simon Raymonde reached out to cover 'Not Yet Remembered' from his 'Ambient 2: Plateaux of Mirror' collaboration with Brian... more

release:
Selected Ambient Works Volume II 
            
              (Warp Records)
title_full:
Aphex Twin

              —
              Selected Ambient Works Volume II (Expanded Edition)
            
              (Warp Records)
label: Expanded Edition
description:
Expanded 30th anniversary edition includes all songs on all formats for the first time, including the previously vinyl-exclusive track #19 alongside two additional tracks (officially released and on physical formats for the first time). Artwork by Paul Nicholson, the original album and Aphex logo designer.

It’s fair to say that a whole generation of ravers grew up with a copy of this album in one of its many forms (there are multiple editions with very slightly different tracklists) but the effect remains the same; a deeply hypnotic sense of déjà entendu... more

title_full:
Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan & Party

              —
              Chain of Light
            
              (Real World Records)
label: Real World Records
description:
Discovered recently in the Real World archives, 'Chain of Light' was recorded by Khan and his qawwali troupe in 1990, just before he hit superstardom. It's engineered by Canadian guitarist Michael Brook and contains four traditional compositions, featuring the never-before-recorded Urdu qawwal 'Ya Gaus Ya Meeran'.

One of the most highly-regarded vocalists of all time, Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan came from a family of musicians; for almost 600 years, the tradition of qawwali - a form of Sufi devotional music - was passed through the... more

title_full:
Enno Velthuys

              —
              A Glimpse Of Light
            
              (Dead Mind Records)
label: Dead Mind Records
description:
Utterly sublime, introverted analog synth music from the prized early ‘80s annals of a hermetic ambient musician and shadowy figure of the Dutch DIY tape scene, originally issued on tape in 1984.

As steadily revealed in recent years via YouTube uploads and subsequent reissues, Enno Velthuys made gorgeous, melancholic synth music in a bedroom at his mother’s house in The Hague, The Netherlands around the late ‘70s. He had previously played in rock bands in the ‘60s, but the excesses of that scene led to burn out and a retreat into his... more

title_full:
DJ /RUPTURE

              —
              1 + 1 = 3
            
              (Reel Torque)
label: Reel Torque
description:
The 1999 debut mixtape by DJ /rupture - a pre-cursor to his legendary ‘Gold Teeth Thief’ session - is finally, widely available as a 25th anniversary edition with Reel Torque. Joining the dots between African blues, rap, ragga, jungle/breakcore, and avant garde turntable terrorism like no other, it’s 100% e-s-s-e-n-t-i-a-l, no messing.

Whether or not you’re aware of it, Jace Clayton aka DJ /rupture really is one of the best to ever do it. His ‘Gold Teeth Thief’ (2001) and ‘Minesweeper Suite’ (2003) mixtapes utterly set the tone for C.21st club music at... more

title_full:
GASTR DEL SOL

              —
              We Have Dozens of Titles
            
              (Drag City)
label: Drag City
description:
David Grubbs & Jim O'Rourke’s long-dormant Gastr Del Sol returns with a first “new” release in 25 years, an epic 3LP/2CD box set collecting previously unreleased recordings and rarities influenced by Derek Bailey’s free improv as much as hallowed jazz staples and musique concrète, like some irresistible force ploughing through the increasingly approachable, you might even say polite, output of their post rock contemporaries back in the late 90’s. Perhaps unsurprisingly, it sounds better now than ever, too.

Before Gastr Del Sol there was... more

title_full:
dorothy carter

              —
              Troubadour
            
              (Drag City)
label: Drag City
description:
Almost five decades after it was originally released in 1976, psaltry virtuoso Dorothy Carter's cult debut masterpiece has finally been granted a long-overdue reissue. Carter re-imagines songs, psalms and hymns, adding delicate flourishes to music from French, Celtic and Jewish tradition, interspersed with her own compositions. It's seriously magical - essential listening for anyone into Michael O'Shea, Laraaji, Jerusalem in my Heart, Heather Leigh, Joanna Newsom.

We were wowed by last year's Palo Flats re-release of Carter's under-heard... more

title_full:
Skeet

              —
              Simple Reality
            
              (Efficient Space)
label: Efficient Space
description:
An absolute gem of minimalist post-punk pop jangle from 1980 Coventry finally finds its audience, who are likely to be fans of Antena, Brenda Ray, Vazz, Young Marble Giants, Fire Engines, Maximum Joy.

The epitome of a what-could-have-been band, Skeet were a trio formed in the shadows of Coventry’s renowned 2 Tone scene by brothers Gary & Nigel Meffen, and completed by singer Kay Booth, whose endearingly shy delivery neatly contrast the lads’ spiky, jangling drive. They would record a debut EP, ’Park Road’ on a reel-to-reel and... more

title_full:
Don King

              —
              On The Mediterranean
            
              (NASHAZPHONE)
label: NASHAZPHONE
description:
First time vinyl issue of a killer, impossibly rare document from NYC no wave pioneers Don King, the short-lived mid-'80s post-Mars band from Mark Cunningham, featuring Arto and Duncan Lindsay, Lucy Hamilton and John Erskine in their all-star lineup, on a hyper-sensual and humid, screwed Jazz tip.

Centred around two members of Mars - Lucy Hamilton and Mark Cunningham - renowned for featuring on Brian Eno’s legendary ‘No New York’ (1978) survey, as well as affiliates of Sonic Youth and Swans; Don King were a lesser... more

title_full:
ALICE COLTRANE

              —
              The Carnegie Hall Concert
            
              (Verve)
label: Verve
description:
Officially issued in its 80 minute entirety for first time: Alice Coltrane’s enrapturing performance at Carnegie Hall, NYC in 1971 documents the legendary cosmic and spiritual jazz catalyst joined by an all-star ensemble; Pharoah Sanders, Archie Sheep, Jimmy Garrison, Cecil McBee. Ed Blackwell and others from her late husband’s band.

Not every day that a cosmic jazz mindblower returns to orbit, but then again there’s a lunar eclipse this week… First partially surfacing unofficially in 2018, now mercifully available in full, this pressing of... more

title_full:
System Exclusive

              —
              Summertime
            
              (Terrestrial Funk)
label: Terrestrial Funk
description:
Whew we have a hot one for ya! A string of street-soul/downbeat and early rave techno pearls finally finds their audience after 30 years languishing as a sought-after white label - huge tip for all soundsystem obsessives, anyone who copped and loved that V4 Visions comp, Soul II Soul, Joyce Sims....

Just oozing with pie-eyed early ‘90s optimism, the ’Summertime’ EP is excavated from Simon Akers & Jason Brown’s vaults for a full release with Terrestrial Funk, augmented by 4 additional cuts. Dusted down from original DATs the vibes properly... more

title_full:
MOONDOG

              —
              H'art Songs
            
              (ROOF MUSIC / Managram Musikverlag)
label: ROOF MUSIC / Managram Musikverlag
description:
Moondog’s canonic album of jaunty jazz songcraft is finally repressed nigh on a half century since its first release, bearing 10 inimitable tunes about everything from pigmy pigs to reflections on human rights (and goose, and shark rights, for that matter) set to unique distillations of jazz-classical keys comparable to everyone from Reich and Glass’s minimalism, or Partch’s unusual tunings, but evidently in a lane of his own. A real special thing that sounds something like Robert Wyatt via Harry Partch… ✨

“Moondog's jovial H'art Songs was... more

title_full:
Nico

              —
              Desertshore
            
              (Domino Recording Co)
label: Domino Recording Co
description:
A real, bona fide all-timer, misunderstood when it was released in 1970, Nico's arid, moonlit masterpiece has never sounded more relevant, drawing from medieval folk and German classical music to sketch out a gothic landscape of death and despair. If you've never clapped ears on this one, know that its ripples of influence will have no doubt reached you several times over.

'Desertshore' arrived just two years after 'The Marble Index', Nico's notoriously desolate second album that swerved from the sound of 'Chelsea Girl', replacing its... more

title_full:
Carrier

              —
              Pre-Millenium Witchcraft (1995-1998)
            
              (Berceuse Heroique)
description:
deadly deadly deadly 70 minute session from cult UK club technician Carrier hailing his roots in mid-late ‘90s D&B with a ridiculously strong mixtape of pre-millennial, post-junglist rufige - 100% essential for fans of the golden era, the bruk out, Raime and Logos’ Reel Torque mixes, and anyone sick of being recommended Intelligent Liquid D&B to Chill and Study to. 

‘Pre-Millennium Witchcraft (1995 - 1998)’ is Guy Brewer’s love note to his teenaged years, when older siblings and their mates introduced him to the hardcore jungle-derived... more

title_full:
ROY MONTGOMERY

              —
              Temple IV
            
              (Kranky)
label: Kranky
description:
An influence on everyone from Grouper to Rat Heart, the perennially rated Kiwi guitarist Roy Montgomery is at his most lyrically instrumental, evocative best on early solo side ’Temple IV’, which is newly expanded and now finally pressed on vinyl for the first time.

In 1995, guitarist Roy Montgomery broke solo from his roles in pivotal ‘80s New Zealand bands, Dadamah, Dissolve, Hash Jar Tempo, and The Pin Group, with a pair of sublime self-portraits, ‘Scenes from the South Island’, and this, ‘Temple IV’, which was only ever... more

title_full:
Juan Camilo

              —
              Bailando En El Obrero
            
              (Shotta Tapes)
label: Shotta Tapes
description:
Tom Boogz’ aka Rat Heart invites his pal Juan Camilo for a heavy trip into El Obrero, one of the most emblematic neighbourhoods of the capital of southwestern Colombia’s Valle del Cauca, with a handpicked selection of dripping bangers highlighting the more aggressive styles of salsa heard on the steets of Cali by night.

For 90 minutes Camilo offers a hot and horny taste of the neighbourhood where salsa rhythms from the Antilles took root in Cali, the capital of the Valle del Cauca region, and Colombia’s 3rd largest metropolis after Bogotá... more

title_full:
hecker

              —
              Resynthese FAVN
            
              (Blank Forms Editions)
label: Blank Forms Editions
description: Hecker does it with the lights on!!! In pursuit of a 50 hour release in 2021, pioneering sound artist of our time, Florian Hecker - collaborator of Aphex Twin, Mark Leckey, Reza Negarestani - persists in reframing doors of perception on Blank Forms’ 10xCD presentation of a near 9-hour, 2017 installation soundtrack: an uncompromising, poetic trek into uncanny valley properties of synthetic timbre; short-circuiting distinctions of text, sound, dreams with a vividly sober yet psychedelic sensuality that prizes electronic music for what it’s... more

title_full:
Sussan Deyhim & Richard Horowitz

              —
              The Invisible Road: Original Recordings, 1985–1990
            
              (Freedom To Spend)
label: Freedom To Spend
description: If you heard Richard Horowitz's mind-blowing 'Eros In Arabia', you'll be well prepared. Freedom to Spend has dug out a suite of unheard early material from the NYC composer made with Iranian-American artist Sussan Deyhim, and it's a revelation - properly spannered downtown experimentation that casts Deyhim's ornate vocal melodies against a backdrop of Horowitz's big-brained electronic expressions. Whether you're into Kate Bush's 'Hounds of Love', Laurie Anderson's 'Excellent Birds'or Byrne and Eno's 'My Life in the Bush of... more

release: New Music for Electronic and Recorded Media
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              New Music for Electronic and Recorded Media
            
              (Blume)
label: Blume
description:
Out of print since it was released in 1977, this weighty anthology remains one of the most crucial feminist statements in the history of experimental music, featuring foundational pieces from Annea Lockwood, Pauline Oliveros, Laurie Anderson, Laurie Spiegel, Ruth Anderson, Johanna M. Beyer and Megan Roberts. 

When it was originally issued, 'New Music for Electronic and Recorded Media' kickstarted a quiet revolution. The compilation was the first set of experimental music entirely focused on women composers, some of whom had... more

title_full:
Modrá

              —
              Bohemian Blue
            
              (Infinite Expanse)
label: Infinite Expanse
description:
Recorded in the early '90s, 'Bohemian Blue' emerged from the depths of the Czech underground, a cracked mirror of slowed-down tape loops, metallophone chimes and pitch-bent prepared strings dreamt up by Jaroslav Kořán, his synth-builder brother Michal and guitarist Marek Hanzlík. It's a whisper-quiet album that drifts between levitational folk-rooted ambience and heady avant new age - RIYL Jon Hassell, Laraaji, Christina Vantzou or even Pan American.

Years ahead of its time, MODRÁ's single full-length is an oily... more

title_full:
Roots Manuva

              —
              Brand New Second Hand
            
              (Big Dada)
label: Big Dada
description:
Hard nostalgic flashbacks served with a reissue of Roots Manuva’s debut album, the ruggeder, darker precedent to his landmark ‘Run Come Save Me’, studded with Prussian nuggz.

Now 25 years old and making us feel the cold in our bones, ‘Brand New Second Hand’ was the one that placed the elder statesman of UK hip hop on the map, giving a distinctly Black British voice to the sound at a time when US hip hop absolutely dominated. On a mix of brooding, dubwise downbeats and more rambunctious bashment mostly produced by the man... more

title_full:
GALAXIE 500

              —
              Uncollected Noise New York ’88​-​’​90
            
              (20-20-20 / Silver Current)
label: 20-20-20 / Silver Current
description:
Compiled by Galaxie 500 and made up of unreleased studio recordings and rarities from the trio's glory days - around the release of their three classic albums - 'Uncollected Noise New York' is a comprehensive set that finally completes the story of one of indie-rock's most beloved underground acts.

Dean Wareham, Naomi Yang and Damon Krukowski were studying at Harvard University in the early '80s when they started playing together, despite having met at high school in New York City. So when Krukowski and Wareham started an indie... more

title_full:
CURRENT 93

              —
              The Long Shadow Falls
            
              (Dirter Promotions)
label: Dirter Promotions
description:
Current 93’s first box set after more than 40 years of operations is, perhaps expectedly, a brobdingnagian affair of 7 x CDs plus a 7” and art book weighing in at nearly 9 hours and spanning 41 unknown and “redreamt" mixes that were mostly issued individually as custom lathe-cuts, now collected with extra works for the most insatiable David Tibet disciples - surefire RIYL NWW, The Caretaker, Stephan Mathieu

Aye C93 really push the boat out with some 9 hours of music relating to the (long sold-out) 12”s, ’The Long Shadow Falls’... more

release: Compassion Crew Presents 'Compassion Cuts, Sins & Dollar Bins'
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Compassion Crew Presents 'Compassion Cuts, Sins & Dollar Bins'
            
              (Compassion Cuts Records)
label: Compassion Cuts Records
description:
Superb selections joining dots between gospel, noise, zouk, disco, soul, fast rap, psych-folk and UK techno, plotted by Dublin’s elusive Compassion Crew.

Nearly a decade since their debut venture, the deep diggers of Compassion Crew repeat the magic of 2016’s excellent ‘Compassion Cuts, Tapes & Acetates’ comp by pulling threads from myriad fringes into a storytelling tapestry of styles on 'Compassion Cuts, Sins & Dollar Bins’.

All legit licensed from source, it grabs hearts form the off with the gospel soul harmonies of  Friends and... more

title_full:
The Richter Band

              —
              Smetana
            
              (Infinite Expanse)
label: Infinite Expanse
description:
First time on vinyl for this gorgeous artefact of early 90’s Czech ambient folk, issued in 1990 and gaining considerable interest over the last year or so since a tape reissue via London’s Infinite Expanse. It’s prescient fusion of soft-focus, meditative new age, tape music and spiritual jazz will hit hard if you were snagged by Daniel Schmidt’s gorgeous ‘In My Arms, Many Flowers’, or if you’re into Laraaji, Merope, Steve Reich, Loren Connors or Oren Ambarchi at his most outer-zoned.

Political outsider and erstwhile rock guitarist Pavel Richter... more

title_full:
IKE YARD

              —
              1982
            
              (Dark Entries Records)
label: Dark Entries Records
description:
After more than 40 years, Factory act Ike Yard’s thwarted 2nd album finally sees the light of day via Dark Entries - ten tracks of cruddy, nerve-frayed NYC post-industrial gristle and dubbed-out no wave clatter gunked with possessed vox, fronted by Stuart Argabright and co - to be filed next to Beau Wanzer, Liaisons Dangereuses, BGM, Bourbonese Qualk 

“Dark Entries flashes back to the grimy streets of New York City circa 1982 to bring us an unreleased album from cult outfit Ike Yard. Comprised of Stuart Argabright, Michael... more

title_full:
HTRK

              —
              Psychic 9-5 Club (10th Year Reissue)
            
              (N&J Blueberries)
label: 10th Year Reissue
description:
Originally released this very week, exactly 10 years ago, HTRK’s ‘Psychic 9-5 Club’ is a 21st century masterpiece, a new blueprint for supremely melancholy, low-lit and atmospheric dreampop that cast a long shadow of influence over so much music we’ve loved over the last decade, now finally reissued via the band’s own private press to mark its auspicious anniversary.

HTRK’s 4th album is their mid-period masterpiece, the first to be fully recorded following the tragic passing of founding guitarist Sean Stewart in 2010. The 8-song... more

title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              The Voice of Love
            
              (Smiling C)
label: Smiling C
description:
Selection specialists Smiling C once again with another sick selection of unreleased demos and cuts from rare private press LP’s, this time tracking British sophisti-pop and Jazz funk 1981 - 1989, all sorts of missing links between Sade, Scritti and ACR, foreshadowing the next decade of crossover British songwriting.

British pop music has always been hyperactive, desperate to absorb whatever influences might be buzzing around the capital or emanating from the airwaves. And in the early '80s, as electro-pop dominated the charts, young... more

title_full:
Steve Beresford & Anne Marie Beretta

              —
              Dancing The Line
            
              (WEWANTSOUNDS)
label: WEWANTSOUNDS
description:
The debonaire ambient bops of Steve Beresford’s 1985 collab with fashion designer Anne Marie Beretta clearly endures on this welcome maiden reissue, newly remastered and ready to soundtrack dozens more late nights.

‘Dancing the Line’ frames prolific and pivotal improviser Beresford puckering his abundant tekkerz at the service of a charmingly finessed sound that stands far out from his prior run of work Derek Bailey’s Company. Flanked by David Toop (flute, bamboo, soprano sax), and Alan Hacker (clarinet, basset horn, soprano sax)... more

title_full:
Danielle Boutet

              —
              Pièces
            
              (Freedom To Spend)
label: Freedom To Spend
description:
Another notable rediscovery from the esteemed ears at Freedom to Spend, Danielle Boutet's self-released 1985 debut is an illusory Quebecois delight, somewhere between crepuscular cabaret, eerie minimal electronix and wonked, poetic chanson. Not much else out there quite like it, but if you're into Stereolab, early 4AD, Serge Gainsbourg, Stroomy et-al, you're gonna need it.

Now a professor at Université du Québec à Rimouski, Boutet spent her youth in Montréal where she studied music and immersed herself in the peppery local feminist art... more

title_full:
Roland Kayn

              —
              The Ortho-Project
            
              (FROZEN REEDS)
label: FROZEN REEDS
description:
Roland Kayn is back in a big way on frozen reeds with 12 hours of previously unheard, unfathomably layered, expansive and intrepid electro-acoustic composition that almost tangibly reveals a ghost in the machine - RIYL Jim O’Rourke, Gruppo di Improvvisazione Nuova Consonanza, latter stages of The Caretaker, NWW.

‘The Ortho-Project’ weighs in among Roland Kayn’s heaviest, both in physical weight and the sheer scope of his vision, encompassing vast black holes of sound generated from complex timbral arrangements. The late, great... more

title_full:
22 Beaches

              —
              Dust: Recordings 1980-1984
            
              (Seated Records)
label: Seated Records
description:
A massive shout for fans of Vazz, The Wake, Lifetones, A Certain Ratio, Talking Heads! Glasgow’s Seated Records issue the first album, proper, by sorely overlooked, early ‘80s unit 22 Beaches - eight jewels of familiar yet distant indie jangle seductively offset with balmy Balearic grooves

Stitching a trio of rare compilation cuts with five gems previously unreleased in any form, ‘Dust: Recordings 1980-1984’ charts the progress of 22 Beaches’ unique contribution to the revered, hugely influential Scottish new wave and post-punk movement... more

title_full:
GAS

              —
              GAS-
            
              (Kompakt)
label: Kompakt
description:
First time reissue of Wolfgang Voigt's foundational first GAS album since its release in 1996 - it remains the archetype for so much contemporary ambient music and back-room techno, melting camouflaged German cultural references into a timeless, anthemic pulse. This new reissue is the original extended vinyl version, with definitive longer versions of the six classic tracks. Available in deluxe 3LP and single CD editions.

By the mid-'90s, techno had become the language of German youth culture, tied up in the country's long history of... more

title_full:
Bernard Parmegiani & François Bayle

              —
              Divine Comédie
            
              (RECOLLECTION GRM)
label: RECOLLECTION GRM
description:
First ever complete edition of Bernard Parmegiani & François Bayle’s electroacoustic epic inspired by Dante's 'Divine Comedy', the duo consolidating their talents and reimagining the enduring Medieval poem as an intensely visual tapestry of garbled words, tape-mangled squelches and crystalline drones. 

Based on a narration of Dante's text from French singer Michel Hermon, 'Divine Comédie', like the source material itself, is split into three segments, with Parmegiani tackling 'Inferno', Bayle handling 'Purgatory' and both composers teaming... more

title_full:
Death Is Not The End

              —
              Making Records: Home Recordings c. 1890-1920
            
              (Death Is Not The End)
label: Death Is Not The End
description:
The most interesting Death is not the End set in a minute, ‘Making Records: Home Recordings c. 1890-1920’ collects some of the earliest wax cylinder recordings known to exist, pulled from a collection housed at the University of California’s archive. Featuring candid conversations, radio broadcasts and musical snippets from the turn of the 19th century, it's all buried under layers of static woo that gives a sort of Alan Lomax meets Conet Project vibe, valuable as a historical document, but also as an almost mystical piece of sound art. 

For the... more

title_full:
KEIJI HAINO

              —
              Black Blues
            
              (Room 40)
label: Room 40
description:
One of Keiji Haino's most radical projects, 'Black Blues' features the same set of songs recorded twice using just voice and guitar; the 'soft' version catches him at his most soothing, wailing and whispering ghosted, brokenhearted lullabies over almost inaudible reverberating strums., while the ‘violent’ version finds Haino at his fanged best, growling, gurgling and stabbing at his guitar to render fierce, energetic interpretations of The Blues. 

'Black Blues' was originally released in 2004, and split Haino's persona into two distinct halves. Over... more

title_full:
Sheida Gharachedaghi & Mohammad Reza Aslani

              —
              Chess of the Wind
            
              (Mississippi Records)
label: Mississippi Records
description:
Sheida Gharachedaghi's bewitching soundtrack to Mohammed Reza Aslani's recently rediscovered 1976 masterpiece 'Chess of the Wind' has finally been issued for the first time  - and it's a total revelation; a prismatic, jazz-mangled mutation of Iranian traditional sounds and dialogue, playing like some gorgeously abstracted snapshot of a lost era.

A painterly masterpiece that's among Iran's finest, 'Chess of the Wind' was only screened once before the country's 1979 revolution rendered it lost, assumed to have been destroyed. Amazingly, director... more

title_full:
Alan Lamb

              —
              Night Passage
            
              (Room 40)
label: Room 40
description:
Room40 handles the remastered reissue of Alan Lamb's foundational eighties-recorded 'Night Passage', an album of otherworldly resonances he mostly extracted from his "Faraway Wind Organ" - ten miles of telegraph wires that he turned into an instrument.

Aussie sound artist and sculptor Lamb is best known for his use of Aeolian harps - gigantic string instruments that are played by the wind itself. He demonstrated this vividly on 1995's 'Primal Image', but its follow-up 'Night Passage' might be even more startling. The side-long title track... more

title_full:
Dinosaur (Arthur Russell++)

              —
              Kiss Me Again
            
              (Week-End Records)
label: Week-End Records
description:
First ever official reissue of Arthur Russell's genius 'Kiss Me Again' performed as Dinosaur in a crazy lineup inc David Byrne, Peter Gordon and Peter Zummo, plus production by Nicky Siano - arguably the first ever production by a DJ making a record from scratch. It sold 300k copies and is, to put it mildly, an all timer - newly  remastered from the original tapes!

Hard to overstate the enduring brilliance and influence of ‘Kiss Me Again’, a wildcard definition of NYC disco that brought together some of the era’s greatest at the service of a groove... more

title_full:
Concentric Circles

              —
              Eloquent Tirades
            
              (Berceuse Heroique)
label: Berceuse Heroique
description:
Archival oracle Jed Bindeman - the high priest of diggers’ fantasies - one half of the Freedom To Spend label, co-owner of Portland’s Little Axe record store, and Grouper’s bandmate in Helen, returns for a second brain-curdling session for Berceuse Heroique, unfolding through 90 minutes of disintegrated, wavey, outsider pop, congealed acid, new age, somnolent folk, EBM and avant-drone enigmas from the far margins. In other words, call it higher education.

Honestly, we're still getting our heads around the last one, but Bindeman's second... more

title_full:
Dumb Type Theater

              —
              Every Dog Has His Day
            
              (Conatala)
label: Conatala
description:
Originally released on cassette in 1985, 'Every Dog Has His Day' is the first release from pioneering art collective Dumb Type, and establishes their philosophy, creating high drama from their fusion of oddball electronics and classical minimalism. RIYL Ryuichi Sakamoto, Susumu Yokota, Haruomi Hosono or Midori Takada.

Founded in 1984 by media artist Teiji Furuhashi and a handful of his classmates at Kyoto's City University of the Arts, Dumb Type is still active today, despite Furuhashi's tragic death from HIV/AIDS in 1995. The... more

title_full:
RENE LOWE (VAINQUEUR) + PAUL ST. HILAIRE (TIKIMAN)

              —
              Faith
            
              (False Tuned / Kynant Records)
label: False Tuned / Kynant Records
description:
Rene Lowe of Vainqueur fame and Rhythm & Sound legend Paul St Hilaire aka Tikiman on this 2003 hookup, now over 20 years old and still reverberating down the line…

Serious 2003 heat; Rene Lowe's Vainqueur is nothing short of legendary - his output for Chain Reaction rank amongst the label's finest. Paul St Hilaire, aka Tikiman, is the original Basic Channel dubwise vocalist and all-round legend.

Richard Akingbehin’s Kynant Records - which recently released the first solo Tikiman album since 2006 - is behind the reissue of Faith... more

title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Someone Like Me
            
              (Efficient Space)
label: Efficient Space
description: Efficient Space back at it with another peerless, handpicked selection tied together by a loose thread of enigmatic brilliance. This time they entrust Mikey Young to compile a clutch of loner pearls spanning 1966-1990, from confessional folk to adventist hymns, all of it just impossibly elevated. Like opening some abandoned treasure chest, it gives us the same feeling of wonder we got from that ‘Personal Space (Electronic Soul 1974 - 1984)’ all-timer on chocolate industries, and should be considered essential listening if you’re into those... more

release: The Colours of Darkness: Le Phonographique '81-'84
title_full:
Annie Hogan

              —
              The Colours of Darkness: Le Phonographique '81-'84
            
              (Reel Torque)
label: Reel Torque
description:
Right in time for Halloween, pivotal new wave and goth protagonist Annie Hogan slays on a 3 hour 3rd volume of her cult mixtape series for Reel Torque: an ode to her role at legendary Leeds venue Le Phonographique ’81-’84 - arguably the incubator of goth music, where Annie’s sets cultivated a dark, sexy, playful sound that would inspire a generation of alternative music dancefloors. 

As with Annie’s sought after mixes ‘Batcave ’83’ and ‘Amnesia ’81’, this 3rd volume charts the years of her inspirational tenure at a nightclub in the nether... more

title_full:
Norman McLaren

              —
              Rythmetic
            
              (PHANTOM LIMB)
label: PHANTOM LIMB
description:
Described by Milton Babbitt as "the first electronic musician", Oscar-winning animator and director Norman McLaren composed pioneering tape-spliced scores for his films that, until now, have remained unreleased. 'Rhythmetic' is a collection of dizzying cues from his most important works, plus rare compositions and alternate versions extracted from his archival tapes. Fans of Raymond Scott - take note.

Although he was born and raised in Scotland, it wasn't until McLaren moved to across the Atlantic that his reputation as an animator... more

title_full:
FRED FRITH

              —
              Guitar Solos / Fifty
            
              (Week-End Records)
label: Week-End Records
description:
Quite rightly hailed as one of the best solo guitar albums of all time, Fred Frith's 1974's 'Guitar Solos' is a celebration of tone and texture that subverts any traditional preconceptions of the instrument, here paired with a brand new album made with a similar set-up caled 'Fifty', reminding us just momentous his contributions have been over the years. Revolutionary stuff.

When Fred Frith wrote 'Guitar Solos' he was still a member of legendary Cambridge-based anti-rock band Henry Cow, and was convinced the Virgin label was trying to make him... more

artist: Mixmaster Morris, Jonah Sharp, Haruomi Hosono
title_full:
Mixmaster Morris, Jonah Sharp, Haruomi Hosono

              —
              Quiet Logic
            
              (WRWTFWW Records)
label: WRWTFWW Records
description:
Allow Mixmaster Morris, YMO’s Haruomi Hosono, and US electronica pioneer Jonah Sharp to nuzzle nostalgia nozzles on a first vinyl pressing of their 1997 ambient dance saga - a big RIYL The Irresistible Force, Spacetime Continuum, Dreamfish, Tetsu Inoue, FFWD, H.I.A., Fax +49-69/450464

Mana for backroom psychonauts and yoghurt weavers, ‘Quiet Logic’ pitches a trio of electronic music dreamers in fluid, harmonious fusion for just under an hour of gently trippy ambient soundscaping. Mostly helmed by transatlantic duo Morris &... more

title_full:
EM.

              —
              To To New York
            
              (Top Tape)
label: Top Tape
description:
Oozing with snake-hipped rock ’n roll sleaze and ‘80s DIY post-punk moxie, Menko Konings’ 3rd volume of remastered re-releases properly scratch an itch for NYC no wave via Lynch scores and nEuro noir - think Lou Reed guzzling quaaludes with James Chance and Suicide in Amsterdam’s red light district.

In velvet crepe step with relaunches of Konings’ ‘Dedicated to Charles Bronson’ (1986) & ‘B-Movies’ (1985), the 13 song ‘To To New York’ (1984) scrolls right back to the self-released ground zero by the artist also cultishly regarded as... more

release: Crumbling Concrete and Rusted Iron: A Soviet Punk Cassette, 1985-1992
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Crumbling Concrete and Rusted Iron: A Soviet Punk Cassette, 1985-1992
            
              (Death Is Not The End)
label: Death Is Not The End
description:
Absolute fire this, a mixtape survey of punk, no wave and all sorts of angular post-punk fantasies from the USSR, 1985-1992.

You can go whistle for a tracklist for this one, but trust that it’s all top grade, shot from the hip, frazzled, growling and assymetric as fuck, from stomping jangle to more light-footed, motorilk post-punk to some lost-in-translation Casio dub bubblers and into more bleak gothic realms - and not a dud in sight.

Issued in partnership with Philadelphia's World Gone Mad.

            more

title_full:
Richard Teitelbaum

              —
              Asparagus
            
              (BLACK TRUFFLE)
label: BLACK TRUFFLE
description:
Iconic American composer and synth innovator Richard Teitelbaum's influential soundtrack to Suzan Pitt’s cult short film 'Asparagus' has finally been unearthed and fleshed out for a proper release for the first time, presented in its original form, with an expanded 'European Version' and a new performance of 'Threshold Music' from Leila Bordreuil, Alvin Curran, Daniel Fishkin, Miguel Frasconi and Matt Sargent.

Black Truffle just keep cranking them out, with no duff ones in sight. This one's been a long time coming, too; Suzan Pitt's... more

title_full:
Young Sparks

              —
              Young Sparks
            
              (Fleetway Tapes)
label: Fleetway Tapes
description: An early despatch from A Colourful Storm’s cult sublabel Fleetway Tapes, Young Sparks is now revealed to be the work of prolific archivist and engineer Mikey Young, who recently appeared on these pages as curator of Efficient Space’s gorgeously lovesick ‘Someone Like Me’ comp. On this hallucinatory, hour-long collage, he takes a deep dive into Australia’s psychedelic underground on a deep and mysterious session that's filled with tainted ambience and oddball folk, jerky pop and syrupy new age - most of it way beyond our radar... more

title_full:
Mad Cobra & Prince Jazzbo

              —
              Goldmine (Dubbed Out by Prince Jazzbo)
            
              (333)
label: Dubbed Out by Prince Jazzbo
description:
Yeah this is a bit special; a first ever vinyl edition of a killer ’93 album from Prince Jazzbo dubbing out dancehall star Mad Cobra - showcasing some of his deadliest and weirdest digital chops, enhanced by Junior Chemist & Spiderman’s studio suss. 

First released at home in Jamaica on Jazzbo’s Ujama label, ‘Goldmine’ was only ever available in its comprehensive form, replete with dubs, in the US, on an expanded CD version. It bubbles back up as a killer instrumental set that feels like some of his most infectious and experimental gear, ranging... more

title_full:
DJ ZNOBIA

              —
              Inventor VOL 2
            
              (Nyege Nyege Tapes)
label: Nyege Nyege Tapes
description:
Angolan kuduro and tarraxhina pioneer DJ Znobia is back under the spotlight for a keenly awaited follow-up to Nyege Nyege Tapes first survey, returning to the late ‘90s/early ‘00s Luandan coalface of what would become a global club phenomena.

Praised by all funky c*nts who encountered it, DJ Znobia’s ‘Inventor Vol.1’ hailed the Fruity Loop-ed roots of kuduro, meaning “hard ass” in Portuguese, in the musseke (shantytown) of Barrio Do Rangel in Angola’s capital city. ‘Vol.2’ now returns to the font of the hugely influential Afro-dance... more

title_full:
Aerial M

              —
              The Peel Sessions
            
              (Drag City)
label: Drag City
description:
Slint alum David Pajo's mythical '98 Peel Session - featuring rare full band versions of three classic Aerial M cuts - finally makes it to wax! Post-rock history, really.

Pajo only recorded one Aerial M Peel Session, dragging his tour-torn bandmates into the BBC Radio One studios in Spring of '98 to dub lush alternative versions of 'Skrag Theme', 'Vivea' and 'Safeless'. The tracks all featured on his early run - 'Skrag Theme was from his '97-released self-titled Aerial M debut, 'Safeless' from '98's 'Vivea' EP and, confusingly, 'Vivea' was snipped from... more

title_full:
DJ Krush / Toshinori Kondo

              —
              Ki-oku
            
              (Instinct Records / Diggers Factory)
label: Instinct Records / Diggers Factory
description:
First reissue of a ’96 coffee table classic by Japan’s trip hop standard bearer and the legendary, late trumpeter

Originally issued at an early crest of Krush’s powers, in the wake of Mo Wax trip hop classics ‘Strictly Turntablized’ and ‘Meiso’, the hour long canvas of ‘’Ki-Oku’ showcased the turntablists’s wrist skills and beat programming at their most reserved and downbeat, underlining Kondo’s expressive flights of fancy, ranging from late night bar sleaze to afterhours gouch out blooz.

It's the sort of stuff that would signal home time if... more

title_full:
FZ

              —
              Forbidden Zone
            
              (Fundamental Frequencies)
label: Fundamental Frequencies
description:
IYKYK!!! After DJ Fokus’ early jungle zingers, Fundamental Frequencies tick off the stunning hardcore body music obscurity of ‘Forbidden Zone’, a Nitzer Ebb and NWA-sampling, ’91 hardcore bullet utterly coveted by the fiends, and newly uncovered as the work of Floyd Dice, aka Production House and producer behind Baby D’s ‘Let Me Be Your Fantasy’.

Prized as a secret weapon by successive generations of DJs and ravers, ‘Forbidden Zone’ was snuck out on FZ, long confirmed as a sublabel of Production House, in 1991. It has since... more

title_full:
THE DEAD C

              —
              HARSH 70s REALITY
            
              (Siltbreeze)
label: Siltbreeze
description:
One of the 1990s' most mystifying rock releases and The Dead C's most eulogised full-length, 'Harsh '70s Reality' is a chaotic, psychedelic monolith that takes the raw pigment from free improv, garage punk, noise and prog and paints it into barely legible shapes. RIYL Royal Trux, Sonic Youth, Harry Pussy, The Shadow Ring.

If you've never heard The Dead C before, this is where you need to start start. The New Zealand trio's fourth album, 'Harsh '70s Reality' cemented their cult status - a double album to end all double albums, or as Siltbreeze... more

title_full:
CJ BOLLAND

              —
              Camargue / Tokyo
            
              (STROOM)
label: STROOM
description:
CJ’s God-tier ‘90s rave techno classic resurfaces - b/w an unreleased belter - for reissue on Nosedrip’s Stroom, cementing a buddyship firmed up with recent DJ b2bs in their native Belgium

Ask any ‘90s raver who’s chewed their own face off, and they’ll tell you ‘Camargue’ is a stone cold classic. Its skin-prickling organ hook, horse-powered gallop and Detroit-inspired, heart-in-mouth string refrain epitomises the utopian glory of early ‘90s techno and still brings grown folk to tears 31 years after release. This reissue is galvanised in... more

release: The Holy Grail: Bill Callahan’s "Smog" Dec. 10, 2001 Peel Session
title_full:
Bill Callahan, Smog

              —
              The Holy Grail: Bill Callahan’s "Smog" Dec. 10, 2001 Peel Session
            
              (Drag City)
label: Drag City
description:
Described by Callahan as showing Smog as "Dale Coopers with our black coffees", 'The Holy Grail' bundles covers of Velvet Underground and Fleetwood Mac with a couple of smoke-stained originals. 

Callahan was touring 'Rain On Lens' with Jessica Billey, Mike Saenz and Jim White when he stopped by the BBC's Maida Vale studios to record this one. All live with no overdubs, it catches the band in a particular mood, so in Callahan's own words "it's more of a performance than a usual recording, because the audience (engineer and producer)... more

title_full:
Crinan

              —
              SICKAGO: Mixtapes 94 - '96
            
              (iDEAL Recordings)
label: iDEAL Recordings
description:
Börft enigma Crinan lays down 3 hours of screwed & deadly warehouse mixes recorded straight to tape between 1994 - 1996 and now issued for the first time, arcing from House and Acid to Techno and back, mixed fast and loose to fully impact bodies in motion.

Split into 4 parts over 3 hours, Crinan characterises the sort of dancing gear that got Sweden’s underground scene moving in the mid ‘90s, during the formative stages of a label that would eventually find its own cult status in the years that followed. It’s a strong point of... more

release: Japanese Post-Punk, Goth & New Wave, 1980-1991, Pt. I
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Japanese Post-Punk, Goth & New Wave, 1980-1991, Pt. I
            
              (Death Is Not The End)
label: Death Is Not The End
description:
A mixtape plunge into the gothic heart of Japanese post-punk and new wave, effectively paralleling treasures turned up on Annie Hogan’s goth retrospectives with Reel Torque.

Ripe with moldy gems, this is the first in a series of mixes conceived by Death Is Not The End in partnership with World Gone Mad, who’ve spent the past decade dredging punk curios from all corners of Greek, Yugoslavian, French and many other undergrounds, scouring scuzzier terrain perpendicular the subterranean rhizomes roved by the label.

We, at the least, haven’t... more

title_full:
David Rosenboom

              —
              Future Travel
            
              (BLACK TRUFFLE)
label: BLACK TRUFFLE
description:
Oren Ambarchi's Black Truffle handles the first ever reissue of a 1981 oddity from algorithmic music pioneer and long-time Buchla collaborator David Rosenboom. On 'Future Travel', Rosenboom uses the computer-controlled Buchla Touché as a virtual collaborator, prompting the instrument to spit out uncanny jazz, exotica and folk phrases that he bends into digital age cascades of plastick notes and obtuse rhythms. Deranged, brilliant and unbelievably prophetic stuff - essential listening for fans of Nuno Canavarro's 'Plux Quba'.

Before he... more

title_full:
Robert Fesler

              —
              μP RPF78
            
              (Metaphon)
label: Metaphon
description:
’μP RPF78' is a comprehensive four-LP anthology of Belgian synth builder Robert Fesler's cloistered, cryptic recordings made between 1975 -1987. The set contains some of the most puzzlingly brilliant isolationist electronic music we've heard - nervous, oddly-tuned fractured bleeps and inward-facing drones presented in Metaphon’s typically luxurious, highly detailed style, with only one of the tracks here released before. Followers of work by Robert Turman, Kevin Drumm, Daphne Oram - consider it essential listening.

K-S.H.E

              —

              (Comatonse Recordings)

description:
Terre Thaemlitz’s infamously more queer precursor to DJ Sprinkles' Midtown 120 Blues finally gets a reissue, one of only a few albums to ever receive a 5-star rating from "the old" Resident Advisor and one of Terre’s deepest, most gut-punching, but still somehow most life affirming projects, coming to us *from a place of lived experience* = one for the ages.

Thaemlitz looks down the timeline to 2006, and the birth of Kami-Sakunobe House Explosion (K-S.H.E.) with a redelivery of ‘Routes Not Roots’; a now-classic 12 track album... more

title_full:
Cooly

              —
              Freedom
            
              (333)

Reissue of a rare as chuff late ‘80s digi-dancehall killller - the one and only release on Mad indian Records, which now goes for mad money.

DINTE’s 333 series do the dance another solid with this fresh cut of Cooly’s melodic bubbler ‘Freedom’, backed with its axe-chopped, one-off riddim, produced by Philip Smart at his legendary HC&F studio on Long Island. Dug from 333’s treasure trove of near mythical bullets, this one is among their deadliest, with ‘Freedom’ setting the church disciplined but rawly expressive shan diddly woi of Cooly... more

release: Virtual Dreams II - Ambient Explorations In The House & Techno Age, Japan 1993-1999
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Virtual Dreams II - Ambient Explorations In The House & Techno Age, Japan 1993-1999
            
              (Music From Memory)

description:
Music From Memory chase their cherished survey of 90s ambient techno with a sparkling set of its Japanese echoes little known beyond its domestic market compiled by Jamie Tiller (RIP) and Eiji Taniguchi - consider it a guided tour to a parallel dimension, primed for the gouch out and lucid dreaming.

Flush with fluttering arps and sanguine grooves, ’Virtual Dreams II - Ambient Explorations 1993-1999’ scans a familiar yet oddly distant sound adjacent to the formative sounds of Warp’s AI series and a whole cohort of ‘90s Western producers... more

title_full:
REDUCER

              —
              Reducer
            
              (Downwards)
label: Downwards
description:
Yep, this is sick. Downwards uncover a legendary 1985-1991 tape from ex members of Bauhaus, Band of Mercy, and other Northampton groups - rumoured to have been originally destined for On-U Sound - including cantankerous Sleng Teng versions - finally issued almost 40 years later. Huge tip if yr into Mark Stewart, Adrian Sherwood, Killing Joke, Tones on Tail, Gerry Kenny/Sir Freddie Viadukt, Part 1, PiL, Bauhaus!

Reducer’s self-titled album is a completely unpredicted rocket from the crypt of a perhaps unlikely, yet fecund... more

title_full:
Margo Guryan

              —
              Words And Music
            
              (Numero Group)
label: Numero Group
description:
Numero collects the entire recorded output of cult singer-songwriter Margo Guryan on 'Words and Music', displaying the breadth of her scope beyond the viral hit 'Why do I Cry?'. Exotica/breaks diggers - this one's stacked.

Perhaps best known as a songwriter who penned commercial hits like 'Sunday Morning', a US smash recorded by Spanky and Our Gang and Oliver, Guryan had ideas that went beyond the Billboard charts. She'd studied jazz at music school, working alongside Ornette Coleman and Don Cherry, and was fascinated by the... more

title_full:
Dennis Bovell

              —
              Sufferer Sounds
            
              (Disciples)
label: Disciples
description:
Dub legend Dennis Bovell - who's worked with everyone from The Slits and Orange Juice to Fela Kuti and I Roy - gets a grand retrospective featuring deep cuts and lesser known versions from 1976-80, remastered at Dubplates & Mastering.

In 1976, when he temporarily shuttered his Jah Sufferer Sound System, briefly joining Coxone Sound, Bovell entered a prolific period of output, engineering classics like Janey Kay's 'Silly Games' and The Slits' epochal 'Cut'. 'Sufferer Sounds' focuses in on this era, pulling together loosies and... more

title_full:
Kamalesh Maitra

              —
              Raag Kirwani on Tabla Tarang
            
              (BLACK TRUFFLE)
label: BLACK TRUFFLE
description:
The most entrancing release yet in Black Truffle's ongoing series of Indian archival releases, this one finds tabla master Kamalesh Maitra re-imagining the Raag Kirwani using the tabla tarang, a rarely used set of microtonally tuned tablas. A rhythmelodic masterclass, this'll be crucial listening for anyone into Shackleton, Daniel Schmidt or even Mark Fell.

Released to coincide with the 100th anniversary of Maitra's birth, 'Raag Kirwani on Tabla Tarang' was recorded in Berlin (where Maitra worked as a music teacher) back in 1985, snipped from... more

title_full:
PLASTIKMAN

              —
              Musik (30th Anniversary Reissue)
            
              (Plus 8 Records / Novamute)
label: 30th Anniversary Reissue
description:
Richie Hawtin’s landmark 2nd Plastikman album rides out on remastered 30th anniversary edition - a masterclass in tactile but steely cold acid techno, future-proofed by its sleek, even at times, sexy, minimalism.

‘Musik’ was first released in 1994 in the wake of Plastikman’s groundbreaking debut ‘Sheet One’, and would further chisel the sound of acid techno to a mix of ice-pick hardness and more fluid, trilling forms of machine music that crisply defined the difference between what had gone before, and what was about to come. Only a slight... more

release: Under the Island - Experimental Music in Ireland 1960-1994
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Under the Island - Experimental Music in Ireland 1960-1994
            
              (Nyahh Records)
label: Nyahh Records
description:
Incredible survey of DIY and avant curios from Ireland sourced from years of digging and sorting through obscure, overlooked morsels of concrète poitín, ferric tone poems, hallucinatory noise and wraithlike laments for posterity.

With a pure focus on works produced within the island, ‘Experimental Music in Ireland 1960-1994’ plunges intrepid ears into imaginative microcosms of music practically unheard beyond the bedrooms and non-studios of their makers. It firmly builds on an renewal of interest in experimental Irish music that bloomed... more

title_full:
Meredith Young-Sowers

              —
              Agartha: Personal Meditation Music
            
              (Important Records)
label: Important Records
description:
A low-key holy grail of new age ambient minimalism, ‘Agartha: Personal Meditation Music’ was released on 7 tapes in 1986 as a longform aid for meditation and alignment, based on the teachings of spiritual teacher and author Meridith Young-Sowers. The seven-part epic picks out apocryphal shapes from the blurriest edges of the subconscious - it’s a long-form, meditative head-melter that’s mandatory listening if you’re into JD Emmanuel, Eliane Radigue, Radiophonic Workshop's Paddy Kingsland, Iasos, Eno.

It’s surprising that with the... more

title_full:
PHILL NIBLOCK

              —
              Boston / Tenor / Index
            
              (Alga Marghen)
label: Alga Marghen
description:
This is a bit special; a first ever showcase of some of the earliest known works by drone/multidisciplinary titan Phill Niblock, recorded between 1969-72 in NYC and Boston and previously unreleased, featuring a stunning hour of engrossing material that’s studded with surprises. RIYL La Monte Young & Marian Zazeela, Tony Conrad, Catherine Christer Hennix, Morton Feldman, Stephen O’Malley. 

R.I.P.

An American photographer and filmmaker turned autodidactic composer, Phill Niblock’s fascinating origin story bears repeating here... more

title_full:
Horacio Vaggione

              —
              Schall / Rechant
            
              (RECOLLECTION GRM)
label: RECOLLECTION GRM
description:
Documenting the innovative 90’s-2000’s output of Argentinian electro-acoustic composer Horacio Vaggione, 'Schall / Rechant' compiles some of his most important works, emphasising a remarkable evolution of granular techniques, digital processes and microsounds that are highly recommended if you’re into the work of Barry Truax, Curtis Roads, Iannis Xenakis.

Introduced to computer music when he was studying at the University of Illinois in the 1960s, Vaggione later took to Madrid's Alea studio before relocating to France and joining... more

title_full:
Blaine and Steven

              —
              Live in Porto, 24 November 1989
            
              (THE TAPEWORM)
label: THE TAPEWORM
description:
Otherworldly documentation of Tuxedomoon’s core duo Blaine L. Reininger and Steven Brown, pared back to jazz classical keys and sax, then expanding into lusher widescreen synths, intuitively aligned at an early crest of their powers (1981) and now shared for first time by The Tapeworm...

"This is the "other" 1989 Blaine and Steven concert in Portugal, performed two days after the Lisbon gig immortalised many moons ago on "One Hundred Years of Music". "Live in Porto 1989" is undoubtedly the better of the two gigs (just listen to... more

title_full:
DJ Fokus

              —
              Get A Bearing/Dream
            
              (Fundamental Frequencies)
label: Fundamental Frequencies
description:
First ever reissue of a ’94 Jungle holy grail comes to us on Fundamental Frequencies, a hugely promising new label established by Finders Keepers’ Doug Shipton for reissues of UK rave and related sounds...

Aye, pinch yourself; it’s real! A sheer masterclass in Amen break atom-splitting, ‘Get A Bearing / Dream’ is one of a handful of early works by DJ Fokus that rank among the most in-demand early jungle plates. Along with two earlier 12”s of more breakbeat hardcore leanings on Blueprint Records, and the equally deadly ‘Watch Out/Media’... more

title_full:
Anne Gillis

              —
              Vhoysee
            
              (Art Into Life)
label: Art Into Life
description:
Shapeshifting concrète/minimal-wave enigma Anne Gillis presents a killer new album for Japan's Art Into Life label, cleft between entirely new material and re-workings of her 1983 debut, in a highly distinctive style that blurs boundaries between synth-pop, art, and concrète madness. Huge tip if you’re into anything from Tara Cross to Throbbing Gristle, Ghédalia Tazartès to Two Daughters.

‘Vhoysee’ is Anne Gillis’ second solo album of original work since her 5CD retrospective ‘Archives Box 1983-2005’ revealed her as a sorely... more

title_full:
Intermodulation

              —
              Connections (1970 - 1974)
            
              (Paradigm Discs)
description: Paradigm Discs - responsible for that epochal ‘Oramics’ retrospective of Daphne Oram, once again shine a light thru the most obscure ginnels of British experimental music on this epic 4-disc set revealing a remarkable body of 1970s experimental recordings from Tim Souster and Roger Smalley’s Intermodulation, playing their own material as well as pieces by Stockhausen, Terry Riley and Cornelius Cardew, all harvested from previously unissued archival recordings and featuring contributions by Joshua Rifkin (The Nonesuch Consort)... more

title_full:
Coil

              —
              The Snow EP
            
              (Transmigration)
label: Transmigration
description:
Coil’s most concerted club record - an entrée for LSD - returns to circulation replete with its OG remixes by Peter Christopherson, Jack Dangers (MBM), John Balance and Danny Hyde

‘The Snow EP’ was first issued in 1991 as the teaser for Coil’s legendary ‘Love’s Secret Domain’ album (a touchstone for everyone from Æ to Surgeon) and would most explicitly firm up their links to club music via its ruggedly driven remixes. Each revolving core samples of the folk standard ‘The Oak and the Ash’ by The King’s Singers, the song and its... more

title_full:
Broadcast

              —
              Distant Call - Collected Demos 2000 - 2006
            
              (Warp Records)
label: Warp Records
description:
A treasure trove of sketches, rarities and unreleased songs, 'Distant Call' completes the picture of Broadcast's early run, emphasizing the intimate folk roots of stone-cold classics like 'Pendulum' and 'Colour Me In' and offering sedate alternate versions of electrically-charged tracks such as 'Where Youth and Laughter Go' and 'O How I Miss You'.

Broadcast never really slotted neatly in to any one scene or other; their earliest gear - compiled on the 'Work and Non-Work' LP - had them lumped in with Stereolab and the exotica-obsessed... more

title_full:
GUNTER SCHICKERT

              —
              Samtvogel
            
              (Bureau B)
label: Bureau B
description:
50 year edition of Günter Schickert’s lysergic, DIY kosmiche probe, self-released in ’74, then reissued on the Brain label, back in orbit as a vital model of innovative, minimalist psycho-navigation somewhere between Dome,  Manuel Göttsching and Steve Reich, deploying a trio of durational tracts of cosmic hydroplaning guitar blissfully glyding into/out of itself thru cyclic echo manipulation and clearly paving the way for so many solo guitar ’nauts, from Oren Ambarchi to Dean McPhee.

“Günter Schickert used only guitars, echo devices and... more

title_full:
Nico

              —
              Drama of Exile
            
              (Modern Harmonic)
label: Modern Harmonic
description:
Nico's fifth album might be her most mysterious and misunderstood - 'Drama of Exile' is a jagged, post-punk inspired slow burner that prominently features Middle Eastern instrumentation and covers of David Bowie and The Velvet Underground. This reissue is bundled with an entire additional side of alternate mixes!

When Nico recorded her penultimate full-length in the Spring of 1981, she was addicted to heroin and living in London with bassist Philippe Quilichini, who produced the album, and his partner Nadette Duget, who... more

title_full:
Dorothy Ashby

              —
              Afro Harping
            
              (UMR)
label: UMR
description:
Sampled by everyone from Pete Rock and Dilla to FlyLo and Madlib, Dorothy Ashby's 1968 jazz-funk masterpiece is a vital, lesser-heard piece of fusion history, blending sultry Afro-Latin percussion with lush orchestrations and, of course, Ashby's virtuosic electric harp playing. Essential listening - RIYL Alice Coltrane or Brandee Younger.

'Afro Harping' came at an interesting point in Ashby's career, marking the turning point where she joined Richard Evans' Cadet Records imprint. Evans, who produced the album, prompted Ashby to follow... more
